title: Reaching the Edge of the Edge: Image Analysis in Space. (arXiv:2301.04954v2 [cs.LG] UPDATED)
abstract: Satellites have become more widely available due to the reduction in size and cost of their components. As a result, there has been an advent of smaller organizations having the ability to deploy satellites with a variety of data-intensive applications to run on them. One popular application is image analysis to detect, for example, land, ice, clouds, etc. for Earth observation. However, the resource-constrained nature of the devices deployed in satellites creates additional challenges for this resource-intensive application.  In this paper, we present our work and lessons-learned on building an Image Processing Unit (IPU) for a satellite. We first investigate the performance of a variety of edge devices (comparing CPU, GPU, TPU, and VPU) for deep-learning-based image processing on satellites. tldr: 这项研究介绍了在卫星上构建图像处理单元（IPU）的工作和经验教训，通过比较CPU、GPU、TPU和VPU等多种边缘设备的性能，找到满足卫星资源限制并能够在工作负载变化时实现准确结果和灵活性的设备。
en_tdlr: This paper presents the work and lessons learned on building an Image Processing Unit (IPU) for a satellite, comparing the performance of various edge devices (CPU, GPU, TPU, VPU) to find devices that can achieve accurate results and flexibility while meeting the resource constraints of satellites.
